poem:
### Return to the Hive

In the city's ribcage, offices hum,  
cubicles flicker with morning's glow.  
Briefcases are bees returning to hives,  
leaving streetlights to fade in their flow.  
Over the concrete prayer mats they swarm,  
past Bluewater's shimmering lines,  
while Landsec counts each return,  
each buzz—and London renews in kind.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Landsec swings to growth as return to office working gathers pace One of Britain’s biggest property developers has reinforced the growing shift to a return to office working, saying that occupancy in its central London offices has grown to an all-time high and the value of its portfolio has returned to growth. The improvement in the market helped Landsec, which owns offices and retail locations such as the Bluewater and Trinity Leeds shopping centres, bounce". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Landsec swings to growth as return to office working gathers pace One of Britain’s biggest property developers has reinforced the growing shift to a return to office working, saying that occupancy in its central London offices has grown to an all-time high and the value of its portfolio has returned to growth.
